titles.title: It Is Well With My Soul

authors.author: Horatio G. Spafford Philip Paul Bliss

verse.name: c1
verse.lines:
It is well, with my soul,
It is well,
It is well, with my soul.

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
When peace like a river,
Attendeth my way,

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
When sorrows,
Like sea billows roll;

verse.name: v1c
verse.lines:
Whatever my lot,
Thou hast taught me to say,

verse.name: v1d
verse.lines:
"It is well,
It is well, with my soul."

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
Though Satan should buffet,
Tho' trials should come,

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
Let this blest assurance control;
That Christ has regarded

verse.name: v2c
verse.lines:
My helpless estate,
And hath shed His own blood
For my soul.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
My sin, O the bliss
Of this glorious tho't,

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
My sin not in part
But the whole

verse.name: v3c
verse.lines:
Is nailed to the cross
And I bear it no more.

verse.name: v3d
verse.lines:
Praise the Lord,
Praise the Lord, O my soul!

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
O, Lord haste the day
When my faith shall be sight,

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
The clouds be rolled back
As a scroll;

verse.name: v4c
verse.lines:
The trump shall resound
And the Lord shall descend,

verse.name: v4d
verse.lines:
"Even so" it is well
With my soul.
